III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth was physically beaten at the facility. Youth was hit with
extension cords and had bruises on his arms.
Additional Allegation: Staff pushed Youth.
Investigation Interviews:
On 12/30/24 Complainant reported Youth A was being physically
beaten. Youth A was being hit with extension cords. Youth A had
bruises on his right arm and had only been in the placement for a
month. Complainant was contacted by phone on 1/2/25 and did
not have any additional information.
Chief Administrator was interviewed face-to-face at the facility
on 1/7/25 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Chief
Administrator reported on 12/30/24 Youth A was upset at dinner
time. He refused to eat, began screaming, then ran from the
facility around 6:45PM. Law enforcement was notified, and they
were able to locate and return him to the facility around 1:00AM.
Youth A had walked to the home of a former foster parent. Law
enforcement told Chief Administrator when they located Youth A,
he said that he ran away because he was upset about a situation
with food. Youth A made no indication to the officers of being
abused. Chief Administrator met with Youth A, and he said he ran
because he was upset that he could not eat where he wanted to.
Youth A did not allege any abuse to Chief Administrator.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 1/7/25 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth A reported he was
doing well and liked everything at the facility. Youth A stated he
liked going to school, the staff were all nice, and he did not have
any worries or concerns. Youth A reported he went AWOL on
12/30/24 because he was upset with peers in the dining room at
2

dinner. Staff 1 told Youth A to ignore the peers. Youth A took his
food into another room, but staff told him to go back to the dining
room. Youth A stated he refused to eat, so staff got rid of his food.
Youth A then ran away to a former foster parent’s home.
Youth A reported he received enough food at the facility and never
went without something to eat. Youth A denied that any staff ever
hit him. Youth A did not have any marks on his right arm. Youth A
was observed to have a few small, round, scars on his left arm.
When asked what they were from, Youth A stated they were very
old and happened a long time ago, but he could not recall what
caused them. Youth A stated he would tell his foster care worker if
he ever felt unsafe.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 1/7/25 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported 12/30/24 was
a very active day for youth. There had been a few altercations
among youth and Youth A was involved in some of them.
Therefore, Youth A was separated from some peers at dinner
time. Youth A was seated at a table with some younger youth and
seemed to be doing fine. He then tried to move to another table
with some older peers, but Staff 1 redirected him back to his
original table. Youth A complied and sat back down, but then
began threatening to throw food at peers. Youth A stated he was
not hungry and began flinging food on the table. Staff 1 told Youth
A he would put his food away if he did not stop. Youth A kept
throwing food. Staff 1 put the plate away for Youth A to eat later.
Youth A got up from the table and approached some peers that
were done eating. He seemed fine for approximately ten minutes.
Youth A then told Staff 1 that he was cold and asked for a
sweatshirt. Staff 1 provided a sweatshirt and Youth A ran out the
side door of the building. Staff 1 watched out the door to see
which direction Youth A was going and notified law enforcement.
Saff 1 stated he could not leave the property to chase Youth A as
it would have left the other youth out of ratio. Staff 1 was not
aware of anyone at the facility abusing Youth A and had not
witnessed any marks on him.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 1/7/25 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 reported 12/30/24 was
a hectic day with Youth A. He had been in altercations with peers
earlier in the day that staff intervened in. At dinner time, Youth A
was arguing with another peer. Youth A kept turning around in his
seat to make comments to the peer. Staff 1 redirected Youth A
several times. Youth A was upset and took his plate into another
room. Staff 1 redirected Youth A back to the dining room. Youth A
returned to the dining room and began making verbal threats
3

toward peers. Staff 2 stated they could not move Youth A to the
other dining room, as they were trying to keep him separated from
another youth in that room, due to an altercation earlier in the day.
Youth A was upset and refused to sit down. Youth A stated he
was not hungry and refused his food. Staff 1 removed his plate.
Youth A ran into another room and Staff 1 followed. Shortly after
that, Staff 2 was preparing to leave for the day and heard that
Youth A went AWOL. Staff 1 informed Staff 2 of the direction
Youth A went. Staff 2 tried to follow Youth A, but lost sight of him
when he blended into a crowd getting off a bus at a bus stop. Staff
2 was aware law enforcement had been contacted. Around
12:30AM Staff 2 received a call that they heard through word of
mouth that Youth A was at a former foster parent’s home. Law
enforcement was notified and returned Youth A to the facility
around 1:30AM. Staff 2 had not heard of or witnessed anyone
being physically abusive with Youth A and had not observed any
marks on him.
Foster Care Worker was contacted via video conference on
1/28/25. Foster Care Worker reported that a 30-day notice was
received for Youth A, as he continued to go AWOL to unsafe
places.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident report dated 12/30/24, authored by Staff 1. The
report was consistent with information provided in the
interview.
• Medical exam dated 1/3/25- Youth A denied any abuse.
Youth A stated he did not know why he needed an exam as
he did not have any injuries. Youth a reported the scars on
his arm to be “old”. Findings of the evaluation stated “there
is no sign of abuse or trauma. There were 3 scars present
on the forearms in total. These are well-healed and are not
recent”.
Additional Allegation
During interviews regarding the initial allegation, Youth A reported
Staff 3 pushed him into his room. Youth A stated that he was
picking up his room in the morning, then went out of his room.
Staff 3 directed him back into his room. When Youth A did not
follow the directive, Staff 3 grabbed his arm and pulled/pushed
him back into the room. Youth A stated he did not have any marks
from the incident. Youth A stated it occurred the morning of 1/6/25
and no other staff or peers were present.
4

Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 1/7/25 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 3 stated when youth
were not following directives, he would talk about the situation,
redirect, and encourage the youth. Staff 3 stated he would not
restrain or physically force youth to do anything. Redirection with
his hand on the back of a youth to guide them into their room may
occur, but never any grabbing, pushing or pulling. Staff 3 denied
any incidents with Youth A on the morning of 1/6/25.
Chief Administrator was contacted via email on 1/30/25 and
confirmed there were no known incidents and no incident reports
involving Staff 1 and Youth A on 1/6/25.
Analysis No violation was found. Interviews with the youth and staff,
observation of alleged marks on the youth, and a physical exam
by a medical professional, concluded there was no indication that
the youth was being abused.
Additional Allegation: No violation was found as there was
insufficient information to confirm the allegation.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(b) Denial of any essential program service as punishment.
These include, but are not limited to, the following: (iv) Shelter,
clothing, medical care, or essential personal needs, including
culturally specific items.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth was kicked out of the facility and walked outside for hours.
Investigation Interviews:
On 12/30/24 Complainant reported Youth A was kicked out of the
home and had been walking for hours. Youth A went to his
previous foster placement’s, mother’s home. Complainant was
contacted by phone on 1/2/25 and did not have any additional
information.
Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 3 and Chief Administrator were
interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 1/7/25 in collaboration
5

with MDHHS Worker. Each person reported Youth A was not
kicked out of the facility. Youth A left the facility and went AWOL
when he became upset with peers during dinner on 12/30/24.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 1/7/25 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth A denied being kicked
out of or denied access to enter the facility. Youth A reported he
ran from the facility when he was upset with peers. Youth A stated
he knew his way around the city and knew exactly where to go.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident report dated 12/30/24, authored by Staff 1. The
report stated Youth A ran from the facility after becoming
upset with peers.
Analysis No violation was found as interviews with youth and staff
confirmed the youth left the facility on his own.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
